definition: Pearl S. Buck (1892-1973), American writer known for her novels on Asian cultures, Pulitzer Prize and Nobel Prize laureate
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
variant of 珍[zhen1]
precious thing/treasure/culinary delicacy/rare/valuable/to value highly
bead/pearl/CL:粒[li4],顆|颗[ke1]

sentences.english: In her foreword, Spurling dates her fascination with Buck to her childhood reading.
sentences.chinese: 在前言中，斯普林提到，她从童年起就被赛珍珠吸引。

sentences.english: In the third chapter, the thesis author analyses Pearl Buck's formation of feminism.
sentences.chinese: 第三章则分析了赛珍珠女性观的成因。

sentences.english: Pearls Sydenstricker Buck is one of few female Nobel Prize winner.
sentences.chinese: 赛珍珠是为数不多的女性诺贝尔文学奖获得者。

sentences.english: Of course things have moved on since Buck’s day.
sentences.chinese: 当然，从赛珍珠的时代以来，事情一直在变化。

sentences.english: Buck insisted that our grandparents’ world belongs also to us.
sentences.chinese: 赛珍珠坚持说，我们祖辈的世界也属于我们。

definition: Han Suyin (1917-2012), Eurasian physician and author
Agnes Smedley (1892-1950), US journalist and activist, reported on China, esp. the communist side
Edgar Snow (1905-1972), American journalist, reported from China 1928-1941, author of Red Star Over China
John Leighton Stuart (1876-1962), second-generation American missionary in China, first president of Yenching University and later United States ambassador to China
Chen Xiangmei (1925-2018), a.k.a. Anna Chennault, born in Beijing, US Republican Party politician, wife of Claire Lee Chennault 陳納德|陈纳德[Chen2 na4 de2]
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Xu Dishan (1893-1941), journalist, publisher and novelist
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
John Steinbeck (1902-1968), US novelist
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Bai Xianyong (1937-), Chinese-Taiwanese-US novelist of Hui descent
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
Iris Chang (1968-2004), Chinese American historian and author of the Rape of Nanjing
